bill_title: revise the penalties for violations concerning smoking in public.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise the penalties for violations concerning smoking in public. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 34-46-14 be amended to read as follows: 34-46-14. No person may smoke tobacco or carry any lighted tobacco product in any public place or place of employment. A warning ticket shall be issued for any first or second violation of this section. A third or any subsequent violation of this section is a petty offense. Section 2. That § 34-46-15 be amended to read as follows: 34-46-15. Any person that owns, manages, operates, or otherwise controls a public place or place of employment shall inform persons violating § 34-46-14 of the provisions thereof. A warning ticket shall be issued for any first or second violation of this section. A third or any subsequent violation of this section is a petty offense. 135 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.075 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
